entry.string: The XML-RPC system API implements the reserved methods for a XML-RPC server. These methods are always named system.something and are assumed to be reserved names. This means that other apis cannot use the "system" prefix for their registered methods.
entry.translation: Zee XML-RPC system EPI implements zee reserfed methuds fur a XML-RPC serfer. Hurty flurty schnipp schnipp! Zeese-a methuds ere-a elveys nemed system.sumetheeng und ere-a essoomed tu be-a reserfed nemes. Thees meuns thet oozeer epees cunnut use-a zee "system" preffeex fur zeeur regeestered methuds.

entry.string: In Xaraya the webservices module is responsible for providing the xmlrpc transport needed for this API functionality. This module will not function without the webservices module activated.
entry.translation: In Xereya zee vebserfeeces mudoole-a is respunseeble-a fur prufeeding zee xmlrpc trunspurt needed fur thees EPI fooncshuneleety. Thees mudoole-a veell nut fooncshun veethuoot zee vebserfeeces mudoole-a ecteefeted. Bork bork bork!

entry.string: You can find the specification for the system API at:
entry.translation: Yuoo cun feend zee speceefficeshun fur zee system EPI et:

entry.string: Extended information about this module can be found here. [modules module]
entry.translation: Extended inffurmeshun ebuoot thees mudoole-a cun be-a fuoond here-a. [mudooles mudoole-a]
